title: 109_s2614
content: The Act may be cited as the "Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006" and pertains to alternative energy refueling systems. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, which are used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas. The system consists of underground storage tanks, pumps, and infrastructure for refueling vehicles with compressed natural gas, E-85 ethanol, specified fuels under the Internal Revenue Code, or other alternative fuels determined by the Administrator. The term 'eligible entity' refers to a refueling vendor or person who owns or operates a service station with an alternative energy refueling system, which includes E-85 ethanol, fuels specified in the Internal Revenue Code, or other alternative fuels determined by the Administrator. The term 'eligible entity' refers to a refueling vendor or person who owns or operates a service station with an alternative energy refueling system. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to cover a portion of the costs of purchasing alternative energy refueling systems. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to cover a portion of the costs of purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to cover costs of purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems, with specific application requirements and timing for reimbursement. Eligible entities must submit an application to the Administrator with required information within specified timelines. Reimbursement for installed alternative energy refueling systems will be provided within 30 days of verification by the Administrator and State agency. After verifying the installation and operation of an alternative energy refueling system, the Administrator will reimburse the eligible entity. The Administrator will provide reimbursement to eligible entities that receive a tax credit for placing a qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling property in service. Entities eligible for a tax credit for installing alternative fuel vehicle refueling property cannot receive reimbursement for an alternative energy refueling system on the same property. Entities eligible for a tax credit for installing alternative fuel vehicle refueling property cannot receive reimbursement for more than 2 alternative energy refueling systems on the same property if the cost was already considered in calculating the tax credit. Entities eligible for a tax credit for installing alternative fuel vehicle refueling property cannot receive reimbursement for more than 2 alternative energy refueling systems per facility. Entities eligible for a tax credit can receive reimbursement for up to 2 alternative energy refueling systems per facility, with the reimbursement amount capped at 30% of the system cost. Reimbursement for alternative energy refueling systems is capped at 30% of the system cost or $30,000. Reimbursement for alternative energy refueling systems is limited to 30% of the cost or $30,000, with no impact on other trust fund projects or activities. The Administrator shall not use Trust Fund funds obligated for other projects or activities. Compliance with other provisions of this subtitle is still required by owners or operators. The Administrator is not allowed to use Trust Fund funds for other projects or activities. Owners or operators are still required to comply with other provisions of this subtitle. Section 9508(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended as specified.
